metadata.title: CVE-2017-12109 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable integer overflow vulnerability exists in thexls_preparseWorkSheet function of libxls 1.4 when handling a MULRK record.A specially crafted XLS file can cause a memory corruption resulting inremote code execution. An attacker can send malicious XLS file to triggerthis vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

r-cran-readxl - 1.0.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: r-cran-readxl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.0-2').
